name: DiagnosticReport
description: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: OBR-51/ for globally unique filler ID  - OBR-3 , For non-globally unique filler-id the flller/placer number must be combined with the universal service Id -  OBR-2(if present)+OBR-3+OBR-4

elements.name: basedOn
elements.description: Details concerning a service requested.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

binding.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: statusCode  Note: final and amended are distinguished by whether observation is the subject of a ControlAct event of type "revise"

elements.name: category
elements.description: A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: code
elements.description: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: OBR-4 (HL7 v2 doesn't provide an easy way to indicate both the ordered test and the performed panel)

elements.name: subject
elements.short: The subject of the report - usually, but not always, the patient
elements.description: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However, diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: PID-3 (no HL7 v2 mapping for Group or Device)

elements.name: encounter
elements.short: Health care event when test ordered
elements.description: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport is about.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: effective[x]
elements.description: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: issued
elements.description: The date and time that this version of the report was made available to providers, typically after the report was reviewed and verified.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: performer
elements.description: The diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: resultsInterpreter
elements.description: The practitioner or organization that is responsible for the report's conclusions and interpretations.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: specimen
elements.short: Specimens this report is based on
elements.description: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: result
elements.description: [Observations](observation.html)  that are part of this diagnostic report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: imagingStudy
elements.short: Reference to full details of imaging associated with the diagnostic report
elements.description: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: media
elements.short: Key images associated with this report
elements.description: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: comment
elements.description: A comment about the image. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: link
elements.description: Reference to the image source.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: conclusion
elements.description: Concise and clinically contextualized summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: conclusionCode
elements.short: Codes for the clinical conclusion of test results
elements.description: One or more codes that represent the summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

binding.description: Diagnosis codes provided as adjuncts to the report.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: presentedForm
elements.description: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
